properties.name: Mercado dos Lavradores
properties.tip: Go to upper floor for local prices. Avoid ground-floor fruit hustlers. Best: fish market early AM, flowers.

properties.name: Câmara de Lobos
properties.tip: Churchill's fishing village. Colorful boats, great poncha bars. Start point for espetada restaurants in Estreito.

properties.name: Cabo Girão Skywalk
properties.tip: 580m glass platform. Free (possibly €2-5 in 2026). Go at golden hour, skip 10am-2pm crowds. 15 min stop.

properties.name: Eira do Serrado Viewpoint
properties.tip: Iconic view over Nun's Valley. Fog can kill it — check visibility first. Free.

properties.name: Curral das Freiras
properties.tip: Valley of the Nuns. Try chestnut dishes at Sabores do Curral. Poço dos Chefes swimming hole nearby.

properties.name: Cristo Rei (Garajau)
properties.tip: Christ statue viewpoint with ocean panorama.

properties.name: Monte Palace Tropical Garden
properties.tip: €15, 2-3h. THE garden. Koi ponds, azulejo tiles, museum, wine tasting included. Cable car closed — use taxi/bus.

properties.name: Madeira Botanical Garden
properties.tip: €6, 1.5-2h. 2000+ exotic plants, bird park (parrots, macaws), Funchal views.

properties.name: Palheiro Gardens
properties.tip: €11, 1.5-2h. CAMELLIAS IN PEAK BLOOM IN MARCH. English estate feel. Best garden for March visit.

properties.name: Pico do Areeiro
properties.tip: 1818m. Drive right up. SUNRISE above clouds is legendary. Near-freezing at dawn — warm layers! PR1 partial (1.2km) open.

properties.name: Achada do Teixeira
properties.tip: PR1.2 start (to Pico Ruivo summit). Free parking, fills by 9:30am. Restaurant at trailhead.

properties.name: Pico Ruivo
properties.tip: 1862m — highest point in Madeira. Reach via PR1.2 from Achada do Teixeira (2.5-3h round trip).

properties.name: Machico
properties.tip: Pleasant town with imported golden sand beach. O Forno restaurant (garlic prawns, free ginja).

properties.name: Santana
properties.tip: Traditional A-frame thatched houses. Quick photo stop. Base for PR9 Queimadas hikes.

properties.name: Parque Florestal das Queimadas
properties.tip: PR9 Caldeirão Verde start. Limited parking — arrive before 8:30am. Picnic area, restrooms.

properties.name: Ribeiro Frio
properties.tip: PR11 Balcões + PR10 start. Free trout farm. Victor's Snack Bar for poncha. Bus 56 from Funchal.

properties.name: Porto da Cruz
properties.tip: Hidden gem. Seawater pool, Engenho do Norte rum distillery, best surf. A Pipa = best poncha (closed Sun/Mon).

properties.name: São Vicente
properties.tip: Quiet town with great promenade. Quebramar restaurant (rotating floor!). Caves nearby.

properties.name: Seixal Beach
properties.tip: 'Jamaica Beach.' Black sand beneath green cliffs. 3rd best beach in Europe (2022). Photography 10/10, swimming risky in March.

properties.name: Véu da Noiva Viewpoint
properties.tip: Bridal Veil waterfall cascading into ocean. Quick photo stop en route to Porto Moniz. Best after rain.

properties.name: Ribeira da Janela
properties.tip: Sea stacks rising from ocean. Dramatic rock formations with 'window' hole. Facilities, parking, playground.

properties.name: Porto Moniz Natural Pools
properties.tip: €3 paid (lifeguards, facilities) or FREE Cachalote pools at town entrance. Classic Madeira swim experience.

properties.name: Calheta
properties.tip: Golden sand beach (imported from Morocco). Warmest microclimate. Saccharum hotel sunset rooftop.

properties.name: Praia da Calheta
properties.tip: Best 'traditional beach' on Madeira. Imported golden sand, calm sheltered water, family-friendly. Free.

properties.name: Ponta do Sol
properties.tip: Warm microclimate. Digital nomad hub. Harbor viewpoint for sunset. Sr. João poncha bar nearby.

properties.name: Jardim do Mar
properties.tip: Car-free 'Garden of the Sea' village. Subtropical flowers, narrow streets, surf spot. Not a formal garden.

properties.name: Paul do Mar
properties.tip: Isolated fishing village at cliff base. Precipício viewpoint above for sunset.

properties.name: Ponta do Pargo Lighthouse
properties.tip: Westernmost point of Madeira. Sweeping 180° sunset views. Garganta Funda waterfall nearby (hidden gem).

properties.name: Santo Antonio (Espetada)
properties.tip: THE iconic espetada restaurant since 1966 in Estreito de Câmara de Lobos. Beef on laurel skewers. Reserve ahead.

properties.name: As Vides (First Espetada Restaurant)
properties.tip: The FIRST restaurant to commercialize espetada (~1950). Traditional recipe, fried corn, potatoes. Budget-friendly.

properties.name: Vila do Peixe
properties.tip: Pick-your-fish concept. Select from live counter — tuna, sea bream, scabbardfish. Grilled with salt. Bay views. Reserve ahead.

properties.name: Blandy's Wine Lodge
properties.tip: 7 generations. Tours from €10. Taste Sercial (dry) to Malmsey (sweet). Vineyard tour at Quinta de Santa Luzia is excellent.

properties.name: Pereira d'Oliveira
properties.tip: FREE tastings with traditional cakes! 1.5M litres of old vintage stock. The connoisseur's choice. No booking needed.

properties.name: Fábrica Santo António (1893)
properties.tip: Oldest confectionery in Madeira. 5th generation. Bolo de mel, sugar cane biscuits, fennel candy. A living museum.

properties.name: Zona Velha (Old Town)
properties.tip: Heart of nightlife. Painted doors on Rua de Santa Maria. Bar-hop between Rei da Poncha, Venda Velha, Trap Music Bar.

properties.name: Rei da Poncha
properties.tip: 'The King of Poncha' — try a meter of ponchas (multiple mini glasses, sample all flavors). Popular with locals and visitors.

properties.name: Madeira Rum House
properties.tip: Massive rum collection. All poncha flavors. Not a tourist trap. Locals drink here. Lemon = connoisseur's choice.

properties.name: Venda Velha
properties.tip: Best poncha in Funchal. Weekend DJs, vintage decor. Lively, energetic. Cocktails too.

properties.name: Doca do Cavacas
properties.tip: €6. Volcanic pools between Lido and Praia Formosa. Snorkeling, restaurant, south coast = calmer. Crystal clear water.

properties.name: Praia Formosa
properties.tip: Free. Largest beach (2km), pebble/dark sand. Blue Flag. Promenade connects to Câmara de Lobos. 10 min from centre.

properties.name: Fajã dos Padres
properties.tip: Best hidden swim. Cable car (€10-12) to secluded beach below 300m cliff. Pristine turquoise water, restaurant. Below Cabo Girão.

properties.name: Prainha
properties.tip: Madeira's ONLY natural sandy beach. Volcanic black sand, sheltered cove, calm water. Free. Near Caniçal. Unique landscape.

properties.name: Ponta do Rosto
properties.tip: Start of PR8. Both coasts visible. Volcanic colors. Feels like another planet. 9/10. Drive-up viewpoint.

properties.name: Miradouro dos Balcões
properties.tip: End of PR11. Central peaks panorama. Easy 45-min walk from Ribeiro Frio. 9/10.

properties.name: Miradouro do Guindaste
properties.tip: Sea-level glass walkways 26m over ocean. Penha d'Águia rock. Free. 8/10. Unique perspective.

properties.name: Encumeada Pass
properties.tip: 1007m. Two-sided views: north + south valleys. 'Cloud waterfall' phenomenon. Often fogged by midday. Café, souvenir shop.

properties.name: Bica da Cana
properties.tip: 1560m. Alternative sunrise spot. Panoramic views to Arieiro and Ruivo. Parking empty. 15-min easy walk.

properties.name: Miradouro do Paredão
properties.tip: Higher angle on Nun's Valley than Eira do Serrado. Steeper cliff views. Less known, fewer crowds. Free.

properties.name: Taberna da Poncha
properties.tip: THE island institution. Serra d'Água. €3/glass. Peanut shells on floor, business cards on walls. Fresh-made. Pilgrimage-worthy.

properties.name: Bar Filhos D'Anjos
properties.tip: Birthplace of poncha in Câmara de Lobos. Rustic, CR7 photos. Authentic experience.

properties.name: Seixal Natural Pools
properties.tip: FREE volcanic pools with lava arch. Arguably more beautiful than Porto Moniz. No lifeguards. Steep access road.

properties.name: Fanal Forest
properties.tip: UNESCO laurel forest. Ancient twisted trees in fog. Tim Burton vibes. Best early AM or post-rain. 2026: designated paths only.

properties.name: Calhau da Lapa
properties.tip: Fishermen's caves in volcanic cliffs. 700 steep stairs or boat. Waterfall, clear water. You must climb back up!

properties.name: Achadas da Cruz Cable Car
properties.tip: Europe's steepest cable car (98% slope). €3 return, CASH ONLY. 8am-7pm. Most tourists skip this. Incredible views.

properties.name: A Pipa (Poncha + Food)
properties.tip: Porto da Cruz gem. Best poncha on north coast. Tuna, limpets, sardines. Arrive at noon. Closed Sun/Mon. No reservations.

properties.name: Quinta do Furão
properties.tip: Cliff-edge hotel restaurant in Santana. Oxtail tureen, slow-cooked beef cheek. Sea views. Summer terrace + winter fireplace.

properties.name: Restaurante Orca
properties.tip: Next to Porto Moniz pools. Tuna steak, spicy prawns, grilled limpets, prego no bolo do caco. Ocean terrace.

properties.name: Tipografia
properties.tip: Creative Madeiran cuisine. Revisited espada com banana. Instagrammable interior. Book ahead for dinner.

properties.name: Taberna Madeira
properties.tip: Zona Velha. Grilled limpets, espetada, local wines. Reliable for first-night dinner. Traditional atmosphere.

properties.name: Fontes do Horácio
properties.tip: Hidden gem in Estreito da Calheta. Best espetada outside Estreito de Câmara de Lobos. Feels like someone's home. Bella the robot server.

properties.name: O Forno (Machico)
properties.tip: Garlic prawns, beef espetada. Massive portions, tiny prices. Packed with locals weekends. Complimentary ginja cherry liqueur.
